reviews.review_msg: Dr. Kastner's on-line course is outstanding.  Yes, the content is demanding, it's supposed to be.  The support and true concern she has for her students is a rarity.  This is a professor of the highest regard.  I personally feel though, the class should be divided into two semesters in order to fully understand the material.

I hadn't taken math since 1986 - I was so afraid.  But Justin made it all so clear (could it be that he was so easy to pay attention to because he is so HOT?)  Fair, interesting, and clear.  Can't imagine a better math prof.
Very organized and clear prof.  He wouldn't move on until the class was grasping concepts.  Lots of work, but extremely fair; however, grades were curved.....
He is so nice and cute ,but examsare not that easy though
No Comments
No Comments
Nice to look at.. good notes, very clear

Are you weak at math? Don't take her class or get a tutor. I'm weak in math and i failed the course. She's a nice lady but the material is difficult. The first mid-term was not hard but the second and final were painful!
Rina is super nice and friendly! The class is okay, not hard and not easy. She makes the class fun and she's funny without even trying. If you need help, go to workshop or ask her. She's great!
Rina is amazing.  She made the subject come to life.  Without her help I would not be pursuing mathematics now

she's awesome! best class, best teacher
 she's really funny and shes super helpful. do the homework and the exams will be easy.
 dont sit in the back rows if she says not to and dont fall asleep in class...she'll make fun of you (but in a nice way)
Yah Rina!  She's the best.

not an easy class if you're not great with math. LOTS of work!! her exam material stresses stuff learned in lecture a lot, go to lecture and take notes! seems to use a similar test bank year to year....
Not an easy class. Do the work. Go to the Workshop. You'll do alright.  Rina has an incredible passion for math, never a boring class.

Rina is funny and tells good stories, she can be harsh at times, but she is a good teacher. The material is hard. This isn't an easy class, I would recommend that you know the basics to math in adavance since you are expected to know it and she doesn't go over it. I worked hard and I ended up w/ B-. Go over the practice ?'s it helps.

If there was not only 1 month left, I would have dropped this class. Not really Rina's fault,she's just teaching a horrible class. Homework is not connected to what is learned in class. Material is boring, pointless and frustrating. Only good thing is the homework is done in groups. Can't wait until class is over!

She is a teacher's teacher!!!  She is fantastic with the ability to teach material very clearly and does so with enough fear/intimidation to keep you on your toes and yet you feel safe at the same time.  I will try to emulate this style when I start teaching. Thanks Rina.

Course itself was way too easy, yet not at all relevent to elementary school mathmatics, so I'm not sure why it's a prerequisite for the pdp program. Regardless, Rina Zazkis delivered the syllabus in a satisfactory manner. No complaints about the prof.

strict marker. never gives full marks on people giving their full understanding of their content, even if there is 2pages of showing work. the course is time consuming and a lot of the wording makes it confusing
If it's at all possible, do not take this class. This is genuinely one of the worst classes I have ever taken in my life.
This class is really hard and time consuming, I took it online over the summer so luckily I didn't have other courses at the time. She does not give nearly enough time for exams.

Honestly, I don't think I've had a worse prof at SFU. She is not caring and does not provide help when students are struggling. You have to put in a ridiculous amount of work in this class. Avoid at all costs especially with Joanna
Joanna is super sweet and really cares about you getting your work in!! One of the reasons I really liked this class was because of her!

Joanna was very nice and incredibly helpful, but this class was terrible. Basically something is due every single day and the material is not easy especially if you haven't taken a math class in a while. Stay on top of everything each week and study! Also go to the QW count for participation and will be the easiest 8% you'll get!
Awesome professor, very enthusiastic lectures and well-explained. Makes challenging concepts fun and approachable. Very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend Joanna as a prof.

Took her course online. I have a disability and she was NOT accommodating. She made me feel stupid for not understanding, wouldn't give me clear instructions on how I could pass as I need this course for Education, and was not helpful when I told her I had a tutor. No matter how hard I studied, and even if I understood material, I still did bad.
The final was tricky, but the practice tests were also tricky. I switched over sections from the other prof, and found Joanna to be easier to followup.
I had a fairly positive experience overall. The course material is fairly easy, but did take some work.

Worst prof at SFU, avoid at all costs. She is so rude and passive-aggressive when you ask for help. She does not teach at all and exams are very hard and do not reflect any content in lectures or textbooks.

Joanna is the worst teacher I've had. She does not teach(there are weekly group assignments that are ridiculously difficult/ inconsistent with the level of material presented in recordings that aren't even of her teaching). She has hostile energy and was annoyed when asked to explain solutions.She talked down to students and TA's and it's just sad.

Joanna is a great professor.  Math 190 is a VERY difficult course, there are lots of components to the course that make it very time consuming.  This comes from a departmental level however and Joanna has no control of this, her in class activities and instructor summaries help a lot, makes a difficult course not as bad!

This is a difficult course that requires a lot of homework, but Malgorzata is an excellent teacher. She was available for extra help in a math workshop several times a week, and was available via email. She wanted all of her students to succeed and was very encouraging. If you are taking it as a PDP prerequisite she is a great professor for it.

Malgorzata is one of the sweetest ladies you will ever meet. She is an excellent teacher and takes time to connect with each student. If you struggle with math she runs the Q support centre and is always accessible by email for help. She goes out of her way to ensure that students do the best they can and I am so glad I got to take her class.

Dubiel is very open to giving assistance, wanting her students to fully understand the material. Exams are straight forward, directly related to the class material and practice exams. Go to class, study until you understand, make a couple friends along the way, and this class will be a breeze with Dubiel!

This is a wonderful prof! I'd definitely recommend taking one of her courses :) If you have a bad attitude you won't do well, but Margolzota wants you to do well and will help you if you need! Definitely would take again.

Excellent prof. Math is not my strong suit but needed it for PDP. She was sweet, organized, and very clear. Brilliant lectures and group work in the lecture helped a lot. She cares about students immensely

She is one of the best professors I've ever had. She really understands how to teach conceptually and cares a lot about her students. This class really motivated me to do well in mathematics even though this was one of my worst subjects before. I see math in a different light now.

Malgorzata is a wonderful maths prof who really stands out because she is so willing to help each and every student. If you struggle with a concept or with math in general, she is often in the Q work shop and I highly recommend seeing her for help. If you cannot see her in person, she responds very quickly via email or on LON CAPA. Very clear.
Tons and tons of work - get ready. But if you keep up with the questions and take notes you'll do great in the class. Good luck!

So far in my 2 years of university, Dr. D is the prof who showed most commitment to educating her students. She offers all the help she can. A very friendly lady who responded to her emails the FASTEST SPEED EVER. Provides all answer keys for midterms + practice exams. No tricks. This course is easy as long as you have solid mathematical foundation

Professor Dubiel is an amazing professor. I NEVER liked math and was never good at it, but this math class changed that. She was so good at relating what we were learning to real life situations we would have when we are teaching. She's absolutely adorable and is the best professor I have ever had.

Kind,  passionate about the subject. Her accent can be distracting but you get used to it eventually. I don't think this is a great course; it does not teach you to teach, or explain basic math principles that you teach in elementary, it is strange concepts that aren't useful in real life. Weekly quizzes help you stay on top of things. Bad textbook

This class was kind of challenging and hard. She is not very good at explaining so you pretty much have to self-teach. The first midterm (worth 10%) was super easy but the second midterm and final were hard. This class does need work because there is weekly quizzes and group assignments, not to mention lon-capa assignments. But its worth 4 credits!

In my opinion, her accent made learning and understanding too difficult. The final was marked very hard. And prepare yourself for 2 math movies and irrelevant usage of Wikipedia - this could've assisted some students in understanding the material, but it unfortunately did not for me.

She has been my favourite prof at SFU so far! Lectures were a a bit slow if you understood the material. She was more then willing to go out of her way to help you. Take advantage of the workshops and office hours! She wanted to see her students succeed and was sincere about wanting us to learn the material. Would recommend this class!

This teacher knows how to teach. There are weekly quizzes which can be annoying but it ultimately helps with what will be on the midterm. It is not hard to do well in. Attending every lecture gave me a solid idea of how to do everything. Didn't use the textbook much. Would suggest to anyone who isn't strong at math.

She was honestly my favourite prof this sem! She was very helpful & interacted with the class. One time she even brought the whole lecture cookies and incorporated it into a math problem! Midterm were straight forward and the quality of her teaching was good. She does have a Polish accent but I got used to it

I found Malgorzata to be a great professor, helping me understand concepts that I never have before.  Every class goes over relevant topics for homework and quizzes.  At the end of lecture she may stray, but it makes the class more interesting.  Also, she is very straight up about things that will be tested on.  No tricks, she wants you to succeed.

She is awesome! I honestly was not looking forward to this class because Math is not my strongest subject, but I needed it for PDP requirements and her class is amazing. Her exams are pretty easy. She posts past exams before both midterms and they are pretty similar to the midterms. Her quizzes and online assignments are also easy.

She is AWESOME! Very clear and fair about what's going to be on the tests/quizzes. The textbook can be confusing to follow and she always managed to help us make sense of it.  Accent can be a little hard to follow sometimes and can go off on tangents sometimes but her sense of humour and caring nature makes up for it.

I absolutely adore Malgorzata. She really wants to help her students succeed. She communicates with you constantly, gives the whole class a chance for improvement when grades are low, and explains everything so well that everyone has a basis for understanding. She's the sweetest lady in the world who baked us all chocolate chip cookies one day.

She is so adorable! She's very helpful and sends emails out constantly and replies promptly with questions. She really cares about students and is just the sweetest little lady! I just wanna be her friend :P

She is FANTASTIC! She is so cute and so excited about teaching! She encourages questions & encourages students to ask her for help. She does speak softly so I recommend sitting closer to the front. She is my favourite teacher this semester and I see the tittle carrying over throughout the years! =)
Amazing prof.  She is really incredible at explaining things. I loved this class.

I love this prof, she was great! Really happy to meet with you when help is needed, and makes you feel a lot better when you don't understand things. Make sure you write down her notes from class, because most of her tests have to do with the notes.

she expects explanation, and if you do the homework and get some help. Then you will doing fine in her class. She will give you the chances to recover some of the midterm marks that you lost. Nice lady

Dubiel was OK. I did not learn anything in this class that I could apply to teaching children. The ideas were to complex to be able to relate them on a smaller scale. She is a sweet lady but her monotone will put you to sleep. She does not relate enough of lectures to the homework she assigns, I found this the biggest downfall in her teaching....

This was an awesome class and the professor was great as well. I went into math class hating it, but the class was fine. As long as you saw patterns in her questions, you would do fine in the midterms and finals. Basic math is fun!
one word to describe her: FANTASTIC!!!!
No Comments

I don't see how ANYONE could complain about her!!! She let us take our midterms home and REVISE them for the marks we lost, was more than fair with the marking and was very clear and interested in the material.  I'm going into the final with nearly 90% so far and I just did the homework and assignments.  I'm NOT good at math at ALL and I did fine!!

Constantly frustrated. Not only with the amount of work, but with her teaching. Notes were not clear, lectures were not clear. Jokes were NOT funny (except for those sitting at the font apparently) Overall, didn't feel like I learned anything about teaching math to children let alone teaching math myself which is pretty much what I was doing.

Malgorzata is a great teacher! Yes she repeats things a lot, but it is a good thing because if you go  over similar problems in class, you'll have to study those problems less for the tests.  She's really nice and helpful if you see her during office hours, and she truely enjoys teaching math, and wants every student to succeed
she is very nice and helpful, but her accent is very hard to understand and her monotone-ness puts you to sleep.

She is obviously passionate about teaching, but she doesn't teach very well. She is very boring, repeats the same things over and over again. At least while she was teaching this course, Peter was teaching it too, and Peter was awesome.

Malgorzata is very enthusiastic about math and tries her best to make everything as clear as possible.  She has a few fun ideas that she shares with you and works well with the other prof for this course (Peter Liljedahl).  I would recommend people to take a course with her since I enjoyed class with her.
No Comments

She's not strict or scary, she's just German lol. She cares deeply about her students and there are so many chances for more help! This is a four credit course, expect a lot of work (especially group work). That said, I thought the assignments were really fun! I think that Petra might be the only prof to ever believe in me

Petra is a demanding yet caring professor. Her class is challenging, but engaging. I found unstuckstudy ai and Q-Workshops super helpful for staying on top of the workload. If you're willing to put in the effort, you'll learn a lot from this course.

She might seem critical and mean at first, but once u start participating all the time & show her that u always come prepared to class (tip: finish all weekly quizzes before that unit's introduced), she gets to know u better and hence a profound relationship between u and her. Don't memorize a thing or u'll do poorly. Full understanding's the key.

I loved Petra! She's not really all that strict, she's just German. I found her hilarious. She also cares very much and she will really be there to help you!

Math190 is a 4 credit course, not easy GPA boost or some quick credits. lots of work. 
There is help available - you just have to be the one to ask for it.

Petra was intimidating at first but once you talk to her one-on-one, she's actually like a friend. The class had group assignments, a reflection and 3 online quizzes due every week [plus the draft for the GA]. Just show her that you're trying hard and participate and you'll be fine! I bombed all my exams but got a B.. DEFINITELY GO TO Q WORKSHOP.

Petra is a great instructor. At first she is very intimidating, and I can't lie, I did cry in her class LOL. But she cares about student success and she is extremely passionate about math. People think she is mean, but I think she is just very blunt in a way that many people are not used to. Very demanding course, practice some math before if u can

Never interacted with her in person however, communicating with her over email, canvas, and through zoom was very pleasant. She always responded kindly and answered my questions. I found the course well instructed and easy to follow.

The combination of passive aggressiveness and horrendous exam questions that are based on memorizing the names of mathmatecians and little to do with the actual contents. She's a math teacher instructor who doesn't know how to teach. Please don't take her class as best you can. I never felt so upset over a prof this much in my four years.

Petra cares a lot about her students and made the lecture very engaging. The course was extremely organized. She can seem a little scary but she really cares about your success. The course was a ton of work though. Was very difficult to juggle with multiple other courses.

Petra is an amazing professor! She cares about her students' success. She is easy-to-understand and encourages students to ask questions. The Q-Workshop lets students learn together with help from Petra or the TA. Her class is fun with hands-on activities. If you work hard, she isn't as hard as you think! She uses tough love, but has a heart!

the worst class at sfu hands down.
its shameful that this class is set up the way it is at a top rated university.
lectures are extremely confusing and there is an absurd amount of work.
this is a terrible class and sfu students (who want to become teachers) deserve better

dont take this class if at all possible. an unbelievable amount of work with unclear lectures. terrible class 
honestly probably the worst one ive ever taken
its even changed my mind about pdp
i cant believe sfu has this class the way it is.

The only grade I received was less than an A- overall at Sfu. She was not available for help when asked, often telling students to 'google it' or use Wikipedia. This was because her teaching materials were insufficient for the major exams. Pray you get a good group for the group work, and know exams are 10x harder than the material she uses.

Please never take a class with her!! She made students feel bad about asking questions, and was extremely passive aggressive in her responses. The first day of class she played a video from her husband and son saying something along the lines of: "She may seem a bit mean, but she cares." They were definitely right in the first half!

Petra Menz in the worst prof i have ever had in my whole entire life. She is so mean and makes people cry. She gives you so much homework and does not explain why you are wrong if you are. Do not ever take a class with her.

Petra can be a bit scary at times, I think this is because she has a different background and is more strict than other profs. As a person, I don't think she is awful. I have not had a negative experience with her in our class so far but she does tend to be passive-aggressive sometimes. Just make sure to review and practice, you'll do fine!

WORST class I have ever taken. Petra was extremely rude and condensing, always saying she's ready to help but puts students down when they ask questions. Class was super difficult even though it is a first year course. If you have to take it do NOT take it with Petra. She is unpleasant and just plain mean! She makes learning harder and stressful.

Get ready to do a LOT of work. The grading scheme was stupid and youre forced to do weekly group assignments regardless of having to work remotely and getting 100% on those was impossible. The prof constantly yelled at students and spoke to them rudely in front of the class when they asked questions she didnt like. Ridiculous.

This class is very content heavy, take fewer courses if possible. I recommend getting a tablet for this class because it will make notetaking and group assignment submissions much easier. Petra's exams this semester was mostly based on lightboard lectures, group assignments, and explorations. She may change it up*.

Petra is just awful. She doesn't care much about her students, she offers extra help but is not helpful. I took this course because it is a PDP requirement, I had taken Pre-cal 12 in high school and got an A, this class I barely passed. There is a lot of work (which I expected), but her videos were dry and she is not willing to explain with detail.

One of the worst classes of my degree. Almost reconsidered pursuing my lifelong dream of becoming a teacher. Class consisted of perplexing lectures and an immense amount of homework. When seeking help, Petra was very condescending. I hope someone else teaches this course.

This is an extremely demanding course so you need to be determined to work hard. Has high expectations but does set you up for success if you are willing to put in the hard work. Do not take many courses alongside this course, you will need to spend everyday doing math to succeed. Do all the work as the tests are fair and based on them.

Currently in this course for PDPn requirements. It's October now, and this course has already made me switch my entire plan for graduation. This is by far the worst math course I have ever taken in my UD degree. It's literally horrible. Good luck to all future teachers with this course. I'm happy if I barely pass.

This course is designed for Elementary Teachers to learn basic math. The concepts explained in this course are far from basic. It is difficult to see how this course is designed to prepare teachers to teach basic arithmetic to elementary students. The way this course is taught is almost counter productive. Too much homework ridiculous expectations.

Petra is definitely interested in Math, and is passionate about what she teaches. However, she does not provide the answers or show you the "steps" of completing a question. She leaves this up to you, so if you struggle with math then you will have a difficult time in this class. There is also way too much weekly homework and material.

Does not give enough time to complete assignments but she expects way to much from students. She had three assignments due each week and the course ends up taking up so much of your time that you fall behind in other classes. Does not take into consideration that some students have full course loads.
Petra is an amazing teacher. But she does expect a lot from her students. You will need to put at least 10 hours a week on this course if you want to succeed.

I found Petra to be very passionate about what she teaches, which also her weakness in this course. There way way too much work and confusion for a first year course. Don't take this course if you have a full course load. She's sweet but can be very salty. I found she had a general lack of understanding if you had other classes or  commitments

Worst prof I have ever had! She is extremely rude and just assumes everyone understands everything immediately. However, she is sometimes funny and is knowledgeable of the course material. Just WAY TOO MUCH homework!

I found Petra to be a very tough teacher. Her lectures were very long and she only focused on the easy chapters. Too many assignments for a math class. Her tests were very hard and did not relate to material taught in class. She was very unapproachable and did not like to be asked questions! Avoid this class!!!!

The material isn't difficult but there is a LOT of work.  Spreads marks out over assignments. She's really good about listening to feedback and responding. She's tough and expects you to do your work. No deadline extensions. More than fair with marks.
Was put off by her at first, but as the semester goes on she becomes more welcoming and helpful!

At first I thought Petra was okay but she turned out to be incredibly unprofessional . She inputted the wrong final marks for students and did not change them for a whole day and when she turned she did not even issue an apology. The course is also incredibly hard and the TA was no help at all.

Decent teacher, not enough time given for midterms (there were two of them). Knew the subject well, but could be abrasive at times when help was required. Tries to keep lectures interesting, but does manage to skim over important units while spending time on easy ones. A little on the hard side, but not the worst there is

She was very helpful! I think she is a good professor but students need to put in the effort. A lot of people complain but do not even play their part. She makes you work hard because your going to learn how to teach. If you're going to be a teacher stop complaining and work hard. How can you be a math teacher if you can't even get through class

Ridiculous amount of work for one class, over 40 assignments- online, group and textbook and weekly reflections (for a math class?!) Lecture notes are inconsistent with her exams. She only gave one hour for each midterm, half the class didn't finish. She'll spend 2 classes on the easiest concepts, and skim through the hard stuff. AVOID her.

Chances are you are not going to like her personality - she's tough, can be rude and can be intimidating.  BUT if you put in the time and effort, you'll get a ton out of this course.  She warns you of her high expectations. Do all the homework questions, use the mathlab, and see her one-on-one (completely different person) and you'll be just fine.

The class is mathematics for elementary school teachers but instead Petra treats you as if you were still in elementary. Very condescending and often lacks explanations. Very unhelpful in class. I would not recommend her for this course, maybe for other math classes though she is better?
Very difficult to understand, quite rude, prone to yelling and makes learning math difficult and painful. Not recommended for people who do not excel in math.
DREADFUL. While she might be good for other math courses, do NOT take math 190 with her. She is often rude to students, completely incomprehensible and expects way to much from her students.

She is an awful teacher, rude to the students and completely incapable of explaining herself clearly. She is arrogant and frustrating; and seems to think her class is made up of morons. Save yourself the trouble and do not take her classes.
Dr. Liljedahl is one of the best professors I have ever taken a course with. His classes are extremely engaging and fun, and even if you are not crazy about Math, you will be after you meet him!

been at SFU for 6 years, probably top 3 professors I've had. While the class is a lot of work, does whatever it takes to get students engaged and collectively on the same page, very accessible for help, kind and compassionate.

I can't understand why Sophie has such negative reviews... I have nothing bad to say about her. She is very enthusiastic and upbeat, which makes attending lectures fun! She doesn't deserve the hate she's getting on here. If you have questions, don't hesitate to talk to her! She is so sweet.

Best teacher ever. Sophie literally made me enjoy math. People writing bad reviews are just freshly outta high-school and don't know about tough courses. She's so sweet and organized, and loves what she does. Her lectures are amazing! Yes, there's lots of work in Math190, but since it's a 4 credit class, this is expected.

Sophie is extremely caring/passionate about what she teaches. Seem like she did not design this course but she taught the concepts extremely well. I do recommend the course with her, however, the coursework itself is rough. There is practically something due every day. Overall, math190 is a heavy course load, but Sophie teaches it very well!
Shes very nice! But does not teach much. Its a self learning course mostly. I would take this in an another school
She's so passionate about what she does that it makes you excited to learn! She's also big into getting to know her students and help them along the way. Very encouraging!

Dr. Burrill truly wants you to do well in her class and she will go over things multiple times to ensure her students understand. She is always open to feedback from students and will adapt the course to that feedback. She goes the extra mile to make sure her students do well, definitely recommend her.

Great prof, she actually wants her students to do well and is always super understanding when stuff happens. Contents are ok but shes really good at explaining and she wont move on until you understand too so thats awesome. One of the best prof to take math with if math isnt your strong subject

I took this in person and she was a great prof, she cared about wanting everyone to do well. She welcomed questions during a lecture before moving on. I'm not strong in math and needed this for PDP, I'm glad it was with Sophie. Tests are fair though time given is too short, read the textbook so you understand whats going on in class.

She is so nice, always wants to help and clearly knows a lot about math. However, the online homework she uses was written by a different prof and usually includes things she never taught you. And though she is knowledgeable, she lacks teaching ability.
Excellent class!  You can tell he's a really smart guy, but he did a great job of "dumbing it down" for this 1st-year class.  Very enthusiastic about his work.  Loved the class!
Awesome teacher.  Does a great job teaching math and actually makes it fun.  Assignments, midterms were relatively fair but final was brutal !
Good proff overall, can actually teach math. class passes by super quickly. hw, and midterms werent too bad, but final was a killer :(

excellent prof. if you have trouble with math, he would be the teacher to teach you.  strong ability to teach students the fundamentals of math.  each concept thoroughly explained.  Always available for help.  Nice guy.  Can simplify difficult concepts.  creates a fun and comfortable classroom environment.
